results.title: The Secret of Nimh 2: Timmy to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Dick Sebast, Jonathan Dern, Paul Sabella and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Jonathan Brisby, the bravest of all rats died in saving his fellow creatures from the evil clutches of NIMH. Once escaped, the rats made a home for themselves in Thorn Valley. It was predicted that one day the forces of NIMH would rise again and the son of Jonathan Brisby would save them; the destiny of rats lies with Timmy Brisby. Feeling the pressure to be the hero his father was, Timmy begins his journey with Jeremy the crow where he is placed under the tutelage of Mr Ages and fellow elders who equip him with the tools to face his destiny. A female rat called Jenny makes it to the village and implores them to return to NIMH with her and save the rats from the evil Doctor Valentine. The council decides against helping her however, and when Timmy discovers elder brother Martin is a prisoner at NIMH, he and Jenny decide to save the rats themselves. Made for television 16 years after the original and features musical numbers. Features the voices of Dom DeLuise, Eric Idle, Ralph Macchio, William H. Macy and Hynden Walch. Narrated by Peter MacNicoll.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman and Aurora
results.brief_description: The story of timid Mrs Brisby, a widowed field mouse who must summon the courage to defy man, beast and nature against the imminent destruction of her home before Farmer Fitzgibbon’s spring plowing. With the help of love-sick Jeremy the crow and the mysterious rats of NIMH (super intelligent creatures residing in the farmer’s rosebush), she finds the strength to overcome the obstacles that threaten her family. Based on the story by Robert C. O’Brien.

results.title: The Secret of muscles
results.creator_credit: Dezso Varasdy, Budapest Filmstudio and Hungarofilm
results.brief_description: Muscles are the only organisms in man capable of doing mechanical work. Masses of tiny fibres comprise the muscle tissue. Diagrams illustrate how the fibres fit together and how the processes of stretching and contracting result in movement. Ballet and gymnastics demonstrate how muscles can be used.

results.title: The Secret love of Sandra Blain
results.creator_credit: Jim Tartan and Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors
results.brief_description: The step by step progression into alcoholism of a wife and mother is shown as Sandra Blain deceives her friends, family, physician and herself. The film focuses attention on the facilities and treatments available for the successful treatment and recovery of victims of the disease of alcoholism.

results.title: The Secret life of Walter Mitty
results.brief_description: Walter Mitty is a dreamer. To escape the humdrum of his life and his shrewish mother, Walter’s secret life is rich and exciting by comparison. Walter’s daydream personnas include a western gunslinger, a world-famous surgeon, a RAF pilot and a Mississippi river boat gambler. A mysterious and beautiful blonde is always by his side. Suddenly Walter is thrust into a real-life adventure when he comes to the rescue of a ravishing blonde trying to escape a gang of jewel thieves. Danny Kaye brings all his comic genius into the role of Walter Mitty and is supported by Boris Karloff and Virginia Mayo. Based on the renown short story by James Thurber, this is a comic fantasy which can be enjoyed by all.

results.title: The Secret life of us. Eps. 01-03
results.creator_credit: Daniel Nettheim, Lynn-Maree Danzey, Amanda Higgs, John Edwards, Optus Television, Channel 4, Network Ten (Australia) and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: The telemovie sets the scene for what has turned out to be one of Australia’s most successful and discussed television series for some time. Set in St Kilda, an groovy inner bayside suburb of Melbourne with its coffee set, quirky bars and cosmopolitan environs, the story revolves around eight “twenty-something” friends who live in the same apartment block sharing each other’s lives, loves, secrets and heartaches. Alex (Claudia Karvan) is struggling to get her life together, both in her career as a doctor and in her desire to find love whilst her flatmate Evan (Samuel Johnson) is a lovable, but frustrating would-be writer with a crazy sense of humour and who is not so much after love, but sex, in his life. Alex and Evan advertise for a new flatmate and into their lives enters Kelly (Deborah Mailman), the eternal optimist, childlike in her ways with a vulnerability almost begging to be exploited, but a personality neither Alex nor Evan can resist. Besides, Kelly is having trouble with her boyfriend/boss and she needs a place to live. Across the way there’s Will (Joel Edgerton), a down-to-earth scaffolder who shares a flat with Miranda (Abi Tucker) and Richie (Spencer McLaren), both actors and lovers in life and each with a particularly fragile ego. Upstairs live two aspiring lawyers, Gabrielle (Sibylla Budd), Alex’s best friend and swimming partner since they were eight year’s old, and Jason (Damian de Montemas), Gabrielle’s partner and husband-to-be. However, Alex and Gabrielle’s friendship is about to be blown apart when Gabrielle discovers “the unbelievable truth” between Alex and Jason. As for Will, love is not always easy to let go nor is the truth always easy to face, when girlfriend Leah asks him for a lend of a rather large sum of money. Whereas for Evan, the dichotomy is in how to get rid of a confronting demand for love and commitment by the obsessive Andrea - should he just tell her the truth? Kelly, being Kelly, opts for the truth and finally achieves her trifecta - a place to live, a job and a new love. Cast also includes David Tredinnick, Tasma Walton, Tempany Deckert, Jess Gower, Benjamin McNair and Catherine McClements. (Awards: AFI 2001/2, Awgies 2001/2, New York 2001, Logies 2002)

results.title: The Secret life of twins. Part two
results.creator_credit: Judith Bunting, Learning Channel and BBC
results.brief_description: The 1960’s saw a proliferation in what we would now deem as a socially reprehensible, separating twins for the purposes of scientific research. What these studies do reveal however, are interesting questions about nature versus nurture - is everything pre ordained in our genes, or is parenting and the home environment responsible for who we become as adults? Program two looks at twins Jenny and Margaret who are reunited after 58 years, and the two Jims, brought up in two different countries, one raised as a Jew, the other a Nazi, for answers to the nature versus nurture question. Also tests the theory of twin telepathy. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Secret life of twins. Part three
results.creator_credit: Liesel Evans, Learning Channel and BBC
results.brief_description: The final episode in this series studies twins to look at issues such as the predisposition to phobias, mental illness, crime, and intelligence. Are these areas related to genetics or environment? Follows twin women in America who undergo plastic surgery so they can remain looking the same despite their different rates of aging, briefly looks at the most infamous of criminal twins, the Krays, and speaks to an incarcerated youth who says that his twin brother committed the crime. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Secret life of twins. Part one
results.brief_description: Twins are an endless source of fascination as well as a prolific avenue for scientific research - this three part series attempts to unravel why. Program one looks at the inherent physical dangers of sharing a womb and how the timing of the split alters the type of identical twin you are. It follows two pregnant mothers carrying twins, one of whom has a natural birth, the other a caesarean section. Includes an interview with famous twins photographer David Tepplicher and the amazing physical co-incidences he has come across in his work. We follow Siamese twins in America joined at the head who not only shared a womb, but also part of their brain, which raises interesting questions about personality. Presented by Robert Winston.

results.title: The Secret life of Sergei Eisenstien
results.creator_credit: Gian Carlo Bertelli, BFI, SSR, Radio Televisione Svizzera Italiana (RTSI) and Polivideo
results.brief_description: This documentary on the great Russian film-maker Sergei Eisenstein, combines rare archival material with Eisenstein’s own candid memoirs written in the last years of his life. As well as a groundbreaking film director who developed a unique film language, Eisenstein was a prodigious theatre designer, teacher, theorist and draughtsman. Many of his satrical drawings are shown in this film. Also featured are interviews with his famous friends and colleagues, extracts from all of his films, including the very first, ‘Gulmov’s Diary’ and the only film record of Eisenstein speaking in English, in a wartime speech. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.
